H341.def: = state in which someone is engaged in a conflict with  someone else and acts accordingly

H1993.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects produce a variety of sounds, often associated with animals, but also with natural phenomena like the waves of a stormy sea

H8130.def: = state in which humans or deities experience hostility towards a person, an object, or a practice

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H7218.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

H6191.def: = to take on the shape of a heap or pile

H5475.def: = a group or gathering of persons (like friends or members of the same group) or heavenly beings

H3289.def: = action by which humans or deities exercise their minds to determine how they are going to achieve a particular purpose

H6845.def: = action by which humans hide themselves ► in order to attack another person

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H3582.def: = state in which humans are unaware of certain information

H8034.def: = one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

H3478.def: = man, also known as {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>} and {L:Jeshurun<SDBH:יְשֻׁרוּן>}, including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>} and {L:Rebekah<SDBH:רִבְקָה>}, brother of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}, and ► father of twelve sons -- after whom the tribes of Israel were named -- and one daughter

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H3289.def: = action by which humans or deities exercise their minds to determine how they are going to achieve a particular purpose

H3772.def: = causative action by which humans use a knife or another sharp implement to remove something from a larger object

H1285.def: = a solemn agreement between two or more parties (persons, groups, nations, deities) with stipulations, blessings, and curses

H168.def: = construction ◄ made out of cloth or skins ► used as a temporary residence by nomads, soldiers, shepherds, and even as a sanctuary

H123.def: = man; usually referred to as {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}; ◄ son of {L:Isaac<SDBH:יִצְחָק>}; brother of {L:Jacob<SDBH:יַעֲקֹב>}; ► ancestor of the {L:Edomites<SDBH:אֲדֹומִי>}

H3459.def: = person regarded as descendant of {L:Ishmael<SDBH:יִשְׁמָעֵאל>}, son of {L:Abraham<SDBH:אַבְרָהָם>}

H4124.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Lot<SDBH:לֹוט>} and one of his daughters; ► regarded as the founder of a nation with the same name

H1905.def: = member of ethnic group living east of {L:Gilead<SDBH:גִּלְעָד>}; ◄ possibly regarded as descendants of {L:Hagar<SDBH:הָגָר>}; ► conquered by {L:Saul<SDBH:שָׁאוּל>}

H1381.def: = ethnic group or nation, probably to be identified with the Arabic clan Jibal; ◄ located in Transjordan, probably southeast of Dead Sea, near Petra

H5983.def: = nation; ◄ situated E. of river {L:Jordan<SDBH:יַרְדֵּן>}; according to {S:00101903800100200} founded by {L:Ben-Ammi<SDBH:בֶּן־עַמִּי>}, son of {L:Lot<SDBH:לֹוט>}

H6002.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Eliphaz<SDBH:אֱלִיפַז>}; grandson of {L:Esau<SDBH:עֵשָׂו>}; ► chief of {L:Edomites<SDBH:אֲדֹומִי>}

H6429.def: = land of the {L:Philistines<SDBH:פְּלִשְׁתִּי>}, situated along the coast of the Meditteranean and concentrated around the cities of {L:Gaza<SDBH:עַזָּה>}, {L:Gath<SDBH:גַּת>}, {L:Ekron<SDBH:עֶקְרֹון>}, {L:Ashdod<SDBH:אַשְׁדֹּוד>}, and {L:Ashkelon<SDBH:אַשְׁקְלֹון>}

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H6865.def: = extremely hard type of stone that leaves sharp edges when fractured; ► can be used as knife; ≈ associated with an inflexible attitude

H1571.def: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

H804.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Shem<SDBH:שֵׁם>}; ► regarded as founder of Assyria

H3867.def: = action by which humans associate themselves with another human, a group of people, or a deity for a particular purpose

H2220.def: = each of the two upper limbs of the body, including the shoulder and extending until the hand; ≈  directly associated with strength and power

H3876.def: = piece of cloth ► used to cover a corpse before burial; ≈ associated with death and sorrow

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H4080.def: = state of opposition or hostility between two or more persons

H5516.def: = man; ► army commander of {L:Jabin<SDBH:יָבִין>}, king of {L:Hazor<SDBH:חָצֹור>}

H5158.def: = a relatively steep and narrow valley following the course of a stream, which is often dry, except for the rainy season

H7028.def: = river; ◄ that drains the western portion of the Plain of Esdraelon from {L:Megiddo<SDBH:מְגִדֹּו>} to the sea, fed by springs from {L:Gilboa<SDBH:גִּלְבֹּעַ>} and the foot of the {L:Carmel<SDBH:כַּרְמֶל>} range; ► location where {L:Sisera<SDBH:סִיסְרָא>} was defeated and where {L:Elijah<SDBH:אֵלִיָּהוּ>} killed the prophets of {L:Baal<SDBH:בַּעַל>}

H8045.def: = causative action by which humans, deities, or events completely remove humans, animals, or objects from existence; ◄ by (a usually unnatural) death, aggression, hardship, disaster, destruction, or direct divine intervention; ► often as punishment

H1828.def: = excrement; ◄  produced by animals; ► source of pollution and impurity; ≈ regarded as filthy and only good as fertilizer

H127.def: = the surface of the earth, containing the substance that God used to create animals and humans, and to which they return when they die; on this surface plants and trees grow, humans labor to grow crops and worship God, who sustains all life, but who can also strike it with a curse so that nothing grows again

H7896.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H5081.def: = state in which humans are willing to perform a certain task and show that by their actions

H6159.def: = a large black bird with a thick strong beak, and fairly short legs; it is highly intelligent and seems to enjoy flying; it eats almost anything, including grain, fruit, insects, lizards, frogs, eggs, nestlings, and the meat of dead animals; ► unclean and therefore not to be eaten; ≈ its black color is regarded as beautiful

H2062.def: = wild, four-footed, predatory canine; light-brown fur, similar to jackal, but much bigger; ◄ Canis lupus; ► commonly prey on flocks; ≈ regarded as ravenous and fierce; symbol of roaming, opportunistic, dangerous, fierce, and clever banditry

H5257.def: = action by which humans pour out a liquid, such as {L:wine<SDBH:יַיִן>}, {L:oil<SDBH:שֶׁמֶן>}, or even {L:blood<SDBH:דָּם>} before a deity ► as a sacrifice

H2078.def: = the human activity of killing one or more animals as a religious sacrifice; usually part of the animal is offered to the deity and the other part is eaten by the worshipers; often accompanied by the burning of incense

H6759.def: = man; ► king of Midian during time of Gideon

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H3423.def: = process by which humans gain ownership of land and other possessions, which often implies that these possessions will be passed on to the next generation

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H4999.def: = a location that deities, humans or animals have made their dwelling place

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H7896.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H1534.def: = ring or round disk with a rod (axle) running through its center or hub; either made of a solid piece of wood or a central hub connected with several spokes to an outer rim; ◄ made of wood and sometimes partly of iron; ► used to help vehicles move over the ground

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H7179.def: = dry grass-like remnant of wheat or another grain crop following the harvest; this term possibly refers to two kinds of material, one being the remnant of the crop remaining in the ground, the other being the unwanted residue of stalks; ► only used for brick making; ≈ usually considered of little value and needing to be separated from the grain itself; maybe burned

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H784.def: = state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.

H1197.def: = process by which someone or something is harmed or destroyed by fire

H3293.def: = a large group of trees or shrubs which grow close together and where several wild animals are known to live; ≈ considered to be a dangerous place for humans and domestic animals

H3857.def: poetic term: = process by which fire gives off flames

H2022.def: = a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a {L:hill<SDBH:גִּבְעָה>}

H7291.def: = action by which humans go behind (other) humans or animals, usually at an increased speed

H926.def: = action by which humans or divine beings act quickly

H5492.def: = process by which a strong wind blows, ► causing destruction and inspiring fear; ≈ often associated with the appearance and intervention of God and used as a symbol of warfare and hardship

H4390.def: = state or process in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left

H7036.def: = state which provokes disdain from the general public or from a specific category of people ◄ due to one's behavior or condition

H1245.def: = action by which deities, humans, or animals make an intensive effort to locate (other) humans, animals, objects, or activities, which often requires them to move from one location to another

H8034.def: = one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H954.def: = state in which someone has forfeited the respect of the community, due to a situation that is not in accordance to someone's status

H5703.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H926.def: = action by which humans or divine beings act quickly

H5704.def: particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y

H6.def: = state of not being located in the place where it is expected to be

H2659.def: = action by which animals strike the ground with their feet

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H905.def: = woven material ◄ made from the stems of the flax plant; absorbs perspiration better than many other types of cloth; ► used for production of clothes; worn by priests and supernatural beings; ≈ associated with quality, strength, and coolness

H8034.def: = one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H5945.def: = state of being in an elevated position

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
